nodes.bodyText:
lat2, lon2

are already computed, no need for extra function calls
this check should be done before storing lon2 as previous value. The whole distance will degrade to NaN. Are there tests covering this scenario?

the value is interpolated between two points. For example at T1 distance was X and at T2 distance was Y.
value is linear interpolation of T1,X and T2,Y. I think it should be assigned to "distance" rather than coordinates.
This puts tests in question though?
this is strange, this method is not being called in the tests, I'm looking into it
the name should probably be "deg" or "degrees".

nodes.bodyText: Function should be optimised for happy path, e.g. none are null. There will be two branch misprediction most of the time in current impl
under which circumstances would this be called?
we should come up with nomenclature for these functions and use it consistently
This is excessive hash map scan. In some cases map values are already known, we shouldn't be looking up things that we don't have to

The "two point" function interpolation API is the same for every result type.
What is the point of having collections of function references here?
